bapsflib.lapdhdf¶

The lapdhdf module contains the necessary tools to open, identify, check, map out, and read out data written into HDF5 files by the LaPD DAQ system.

Subpackages¶

  • bapsflib.lapdhdf.map_digitizers
  • bapsflib.lapdhdf.map_msi

Modules¶

  • bapsflib.lapdhdf.files
  • bapsflib.lapdhdf.hdfchecks
  • bapsflib.lapdhdf.hdferrors
  • bapsflib.lapdhdf.hdfmappers
  • bapsflib.lapdhdf.hdfreaddata

bapsflib.lapdhdf.files¶

class bapsflib.lapdhdf.files.File(name, mode='r', driver=None, libver=None, userblock_size=None, swmr=False, **kwds)¶

Bases: h5py._hl.files.File

Open a HDF5 File.

see h5py documentation for h5py.File details: http://docs.h5py.org/en/latest/

Parameters:
  • name – Name of file (str or unicode)
  • mode – Mode in which to open the file. (default ‘r’ read-only)
  • driver – File driver to use
  • libver – Compatibility bounds
  • userblock_size – Size (in bytes) of the user block. If nonzero, must be a power of 2 and at least 512.
  • swmr – Single Write, Multiple Read
  • kwds – Driver specific keywords
file_map¶
Returns:an instance of the lapdhdf.hdfmappers.hdfMap file mappings.

getItemType(name)¶

Warning

Do not use. Will be deprecated.

Parameters:name – name of Group/Dataset
Returns:str indicating if name is a ‘Group’ of ‘Dataset’
listHDF_file_types¶
Returns:a list of strings indicating if an HDF5 item is a Group or Dataset. This has a one-to-one correspondence to listHDF_files.
listHDF_files¶
Returns:a list of strings representing the absolute paths (including Group/Dataset name) for each Group and Dataset in the HDF5 file.
read_data(board, channel, shots=None, digitizer=None, adc=None, config_name=None)¶
tupHDF_fileSys¶

bapsflib.lapdhdf.hdferrors¶

exception bapsflib.lapdhdf.hdferrors.Error¶

Bases: exceptions.Exception

Base class for exceptions in the lapdhdf module.

exception bapsflib.lapdhdf.hdferrors.NoMSIError¶

Bases: bapsflib.lapdhdf.hdferrors.Error

Exception raised if no MSI group is detected in the opened HDF5 file.

exception bapsflib.lapdhdf.hdferrors.NotHDFFileError¶

Bases: bapsflib.lapdhdf.hdferrors.Error

Exception raised if desired object is not an instance of h5py.File.

exception bapsflib.lapdhdf.hdferrors.NotKnownLaPDHDFError¶

Bases: bapsflib.lapdhdf.hdferrors.Error

Exception raised if the HDF5 file was generated by the DAQ system but is not a known software version.

exception bapsflib.lapdhdf.hdferrors.NotLaPDHDFError¶

Bases: bapsflib.lapdhdf.hdferrors.Error

Exception raised if HDF5 file was not generated by the LaPD DAQ system.

bapsflib.lapdhdf.hdfmappers¶

class bapsflib.lapdhdf.hdfmappers.hdfMap(hdf_obj)¶

Bases: object

Template for all HDF Mapping Classes

Class Attributes:
msi_group – str – name of MSI group data_group – str – name of data group
Object Attributes:
hdf_version – str
  • string representation of the version number corresponding the the LaPD HDF Software version used to generate the HDF5 file
msi_diagnostic_groups – [str]
  • list of the group names for each diagnostic recorded in the MSI group
sis_group – str
  • SIS group name which contains all the DAQ recorded data and associated DAQ configuration
sis_crates – [str]
  • list of SIS crates (digitizers) available to record data
data_configs – {}
  • dict containing key parameters associated with the crate configurations
  • dict is constructed using method build_data_configs
Methods:
sis_path
  • returns the HDF internal absolution path to the sis_group
build_data_configs
  • used to construct the data_configs attribute

parse_config_name is_config_active __config_crates __crate_info __find_crate_connections

data_group = 'Raw data + config'¶
has_data_group¶
Returns:True/False if ‘Raw data + config/’ group is detected
has_data_run_sequence¶
Returns:True/False if the ‘Data run sequence/’ group is found in the data group
has_digitizers¶
Returns:True/False if any known digitizers are discovered in the data group
has_motion_lists¶
Returns:True/False if any known motion groups are discovered in the data group
has_msi_group¶
Returns:True/False if ‘MSI/’ group is detected
has_unknown_data_subgoups¶
Returns:True/False if any unknown groups are discovered in the data groups. These groups could end up being digitizer groups and/or motion groups.
hdf_version¶
Returns:str identifying the LaPD DAQ Software version number used to generated the HDF5 file (‘’ if NOT LaPD generated)
is_lapd_hdf¶
Returns:True/False if HDF5 file was generated by the LaPD
main_digitizer¶
Returns:an instance of the main digitizer in self.digitizers
msi_group = 'MSI'¶

bapsflib.lapdhdf.hdfreaddata¶

class bapsflib.lapdhdf.hdfreaddata.hdfReadData¶

Bases: numpy.ndarray

I want self to be the nparray data. self should have a meta attribute that contains a dict() of metadata for the dataset. Metadata that should have:

‘hdf file’ – HDF5 file name the data was retrieved from ‘dataset name’ – name of the dataset ‘dataset path’ – path to said dataset in the HDF5 file ‘crate’ – crate in which the data was recorded on ‘bit’ – bit resolution for the crate ‘sample rate’ – tuple containing the sample rate

e.g. (100.0, ‘MHz’)
‘board’ – board that the corresponding probe was
attached to ~ can I make a ‘brd’ alias for ‘board’
‘channel’ – channel that the corresponding probe was
attached to ~ can I make a ‘ch’ alias for ‘channel’

‘voltage offset’ – voltage offset for the DAQ signal ‘probe name’ – name of deployed probe…empty dict() item

for user to fill out for his/her needs
‘port’ – 2-element tuple indicating which port the
probe was deployed on. e.g. (19, ‘W’) => deployed on port 19 on the west side of the machine. Second elements descriptors should follow: ‘T’ = top ‘TW’ = top-west ‘W’ = west ‘BW’ = bottom-west ‘B’ = bottom ‘BE’ = bottome-east ‘E’ = east ‘TE’ = top-east
Extracting Data

dset = h5py.get() returns a view of the dataset (dset) From there, instantiating from dset will create a copy of

the data. If you want to keep views then one could use dset.values.view(). The dset.vlaues is np.ndarray.
To extract data, fancy indexing [::] can be used directly on
dset or dset.values.
convert_to_t()¶

Convert DAQ signal dependent axis from index to time. :return:

convert_to_v()¶

Convert DAQ signal from bits to voltage. :return:

dt¶

Return timestep dt from the ‘sample rate’ dict() item. :return:

dv¶

Return voltage-step from the ‘bit’ dict() item. :return:

full_path()¶

Return full path of the dataset in the HDF5 file. :return:
